ðŸš€ robin | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Conducting AI-assisted investigations and intelligence gathering on the dark web.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Modular Architecture â€¢ Multi-Model Support (OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, Ollama) â€¢ CLI-First Design â€¢ Docker-Ready â€¢ Customizable Reporting
ðŸ“– Summary: Robin is an AI-powered tool designed for dark web Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) investigations. It utilizes Large Language Models (LLMs) to enhance search queries, filter results from dark web search engines, and generate concise investigation summaries, making dark web data more accessible for analysis.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ LiveAvatar | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Real-time, interactive, and infinitely long audio-driven avatar video generation for applications like virtual assistants, virtual influencers, and interactive storytelling.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Real-time streaming interaction with high FPS (45 FPS) â€¢ Infinite-length autoregressive generation (10,000+ seconds) â€¢ Audio-driven avatar generation â€¢ Generalization across diverse characters and scenarios â€¢ FP8 quantization for reduced GPU memory usage (v1.1)
ðŸ“– Summary: Live Avatar is a framework for generating real-time, streaming, and infinitely long avatar videos driven by audio input. It utilizes a large diffusion model and block-wise autoregressive processing to achieve high frame rates and support extended video generation.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ liam | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Visualizing database schemas by automatically generating interactive ER diagrams.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Automatic ER diagram generation â€¢ Beautiful and interactive UI â€¢ Simple reverse engineering from existing databases â€¢ Effortless setup with zero configuration â€¢ High performance for large schemas (100+ tables)
ðŸ“– Summary: Liam ERD is an open-source tool that automatically generates beautiful, interactive Entity Relationship (ER) diagrams from your database schemas. It simplifies the visualization of complex database structures with a user-friendly interface, seamless reverse engineering, and high performance for projects of all sizes.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ hyprshot-rs | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Taking screenshots in Hyprland and Sway on Wayland with flexible capture options and easy integration.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Screenshot Capture (full monitor, active monitor, selected region, selected window, active window) â€¢ Save to specified folder and copy to clipboard â€¢ TOML-based configuration system â€¢ CLI commands for config management
ðŸ“– Summary: Hyprshot-rs is a Rust utility for capturing screenshots in Wayland environments, specifically Hyprland and Sway. It offers flexible capture modes including full monitor, active monitor, selected region, and selected window, with options to save to disk or copy to the clipboard. The tool features a TOML configuration system and integrates seamlessly with Hyprland for automatic keybinding generation and setup.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ speedtest-tracker | PHP
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Monitoring and tracking internet connection performance and uptime through automated speed tests.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Automated Tests â€¢ Detailed Metrics (download/upload speeds, ping, packet loss) â€¢ Historical Data and Trends â€¢ Notifications for performance drops â€¢ Multi-Language Support
ðŸ“– Summary: Speedtest Tracker is a self-hosted PHP application that automates internet speed tests and monitors connection performance over time. It captures detailed metrics, stores historical data, and provides notifications for performance drops.
